job_title: Part Time Help Desk Intern - Onsite
fragmented_desc: ['Install, maintain, analyze, troubleshoot, and repair computer systems, hardware, and computer peripherals. Be ready for any technical issue that arises in the…']
full-desc:
BHI (Boulder Heavy Industries) is looking for a IT Helpdesk Intern to join our growing IT team.

BHI is an investment team that incubates advertising, media and e-commerce companies that are disrupting their industries. We provide strategic guidance, and all of the capabilities most startups can’t afford.

You will handle IT support for our end-user technology environment across our internal business units. You’ll have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in Helpdesk Support and possibly cross train in other areas after initial training to meet business needs. This is a great learning opportunity for the current student in Information Technology!

PLEASE NOTE:

This is a Part-Time in-office position located in Boulder, CO. This position requires an equivalent of 3 full business days a week onsite. This is not a role that can be worked remotely. The exact schedule will be determined during the interview process and there is flexibility on our end to accommodate for class schedules. By applying for this role, you are affirming you can meet this requirement.

Also, this is not a summer-only internship. We are looking for someone to start right away and this position may last longer than the summer, depending on the candidate’s availability and desire to continue the working arrangement.

We will be including learning and growth opportunities in the structure and focus of this role, so it will not be just a job, but an opportunity to expand knowledge and experience in the IT field.

A Day in the Life

You will work to troubleshoot and solve every day IT queries via email and in person. Here are some specifics on what your days might look like:

  • Be ready for any technical issue that arises in the Helpdesk queue
  • Install, maintain, analyze, troubleshoot, and repair computer systems, hardware, and computer peripherals.
  • Provide user training on laptop use, printer connections, SaaS applications, and other similar items.
  • Assist with the laptop inventory and management
  • Perform maintenance on existing systems and applications
  • Contribute to current documentation associated with internal infrastructure, systems, and processes
  • Gain hands on experience with different areas of IT and present your journey with the team!

If this sounds like a great learning opportunity to enhance your academic learning, we want to hear from you!

Here's what you need to get our attention

  • In progress of completing a degree in Computer Science or Information Technology

Here's what will make us call you for sure

  • 1-2 years hands-on experience in a Helpdesk or IT troubleshooting role
  • Strong computer skills and the ability to troubleshoot and diagnose problems
  • Familiarity with both Windows operating systems (primarily Windows 11) and MacOS (10.13+)
  • Maintains current knowledge of relevant technology
  • Strong interpersonal skills to help customers fix their issues and feel satisfied with the experience
  • Excellent at documentation
  • Desire to expand skillset

NOT required but will definitely give you an edge!

  • Certifications: CompTIA A+, CompTIA Network +, CompTIA Cloud+
  • Exposure to a scripting language such as Bash or PowerShell
  • Some network experience

Compensation DOE $17.00-18.00/hour

We anticipate this position being open until 3/31/2024. It may be closed earlier or kept open longer depending on the timing of our candidate selection process.

And if we haven't convinced you yet, here is why you'll want to be part of our team:

  • Inspiring, collaborative & SAFE office option in beautiful Boulder, CO where dogs are welcome!
  • Hourly employees receive a PTO accrual based on the number of hours worked.
  • Generous holidays including a reduced schedule between Christmas and New Years

COME AS YOU ARE: your gender, your gods, your sex life, your skin color or your big shot uncle don't make a difference here. BHI LLC is a progressive and open-minded meritocracy. If you're smart and good at what you do, come as you are.

Job Types: Part-time, Internship

Pay: $17.00 - $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 24 – 25 per week

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid time off

Experience level:

  • No experience needed

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

full-desc:
Position Summary

The Summer Intern will work as part of the applications team to help support Canon Nanotechnologies (CNT) imprint tools and technologies, with an emphasis on process development for semiconductor applications, and metrology support. The Summer Intern will focus on process automation, general tool use, and metrology support.

Essential Functions

1. Process automation, including writing scripts to automate imprint tool operations.

2. Automation for defect analysis, including JMP script optimization.

3. Design, execute, analyze, and report on experiments.

Qualifications

Education:

§ M.S. or PhD student in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Materials Science, Physics, or other relevant engineering or physical science discipline. Senior students are preferred.

Required Experience:

§ Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages for automation (e.g., Python, MATLAB, or other programming languages)

§ Knowledge of semiconductor processing is preferred.

§ Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills are required.

§ Demonstrated strong organizational skills.

Physical Demands/Work Environment

Position requires continuous physical effort; intermittent and long-term work cycles; standing, walking, sitting, repetitive motion, and lifting up to 25 pounds unassisted. Lifting more than 25 lbs requires additional help. Employee may be required to work at a computer terminal for long periods of time. Employee will be able to hear and understand speech at normal levels and on the telephone. Position requires effective communication skills, verbal and written form. Mental alertness is a must. Employee may be exposed to atmospheric conditions, such as: dust, fumes, noise and varying temperatures. Employee is required to demonstrate continued knowledge of Haz/Com regulations and requirements. Must be able to work in a cleanroom environment, this includes wearing protective clothing.

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $25.00 - $30.00 per hour

Experience level:

  • No experience needed

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

full-desc:
Please visit our website before applying https://purecode.ai/ and make sure you're a fit and understand what our product does! All candidates will screened on their familiarity with the product and AI generator. Priority consideration will be granted to those who include a thoughtful observation about our product//ai generator to prove your interest!

PureCode AI, headquartered in Austin, Texas, is actively looking for a remote Junior Software Engineer to join our team. We specialize in cutting-edge Computer Vision & Artificial Intelligence technologies and have created a developer tool that instantly converts design images into fully functional, ready to use, ReactJS code. Additionally, we are advancing front-end software development by using AI models to generate UI components for engineers, resulting in significant time savings and reduced manual work.
PureCode has recently secured $3 million USD in funding from a Silicon Valley venture capitalist, setting the stage for significant growth and innovation. We remain dedicated to revolutionizing software development through AI-powered solutions and invite you to join us on this journey toward a more efficient and innovative industry. Become a part of our team and help shape the future of software development.

The Ideal Candidate
· Previous start-up experience is required.
· Excellent communication skills.
· Problem-solving skills with a proactive nature.
· Excellent interpersonal skills.
Meticulous attention to detail.
Impeccable organization skills.
Strong people skills.
Start-up mindset and flexibility – we are looking for someone who can come into the organization and improve the way we are doing things now. Not rewrite company processes with a lot of needless rules and requirements.

Benefits & Offerings

· Competitive salary and benefits package.

· Culture focused on talent development with biannual promotion cycles and company-sponsored certifications.

· Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies.

To Apply: Submit here on Indeed or via Michael@purecodesoftware.com along with your email. Priority consideration will be granted to those who include a thoughtful observation about our product//ai generator to prove your interest!

full-desc:
Join the CloudSolved IT Family!

Are you enthusiastic about tech and looking for an opportunity to kickstart your career in IT? CloudSolved IT is on the hunt for an energetic and motivated professional to join our Cloud Service delivery team. We’re not just any tech company; we’re a vibrant, people-first workspace where your growth, happiness, and well-being are our top priorities.

Why You’ll Love Collaborating with Us:

- Flex Culture: Embrace the freedom to work in the way that suits you best, with flexible arrangements that allow you to balance your personal and professional life.

- Grow As You Go: With retirement benefits and generous PTO/sick policies, we’ve got your back now and in the future.

- Remote & Connected: Dive into a role that’s 25% remote post-training, keeping you engaged with weekly meetups to ensure you’re always part of the crew.

- Health & Wellness: Comprehensive health insurance to keep you in top shape, because we know a healthy team is a happy team.

Your Mission, Should You Choose to Accept:

- Be the hero our clients deserve, tackling service requests with speed and a smile.

- Prioritize and manage daily tickets like a boss, ensuring all our clients feel valued.

- Offer top-notch remote support, guiding our clients through their tech troubles with patience and expertise.

- Be the guardian of client accounts, from smooth onboarding to seamless offboarding.

- Collaborate with vendors to deliver exceptional service experiences.

- Keep our client database as sharp as your tech skills.

What Makes You a Perfect Fit:

- A meticulous, communication maestro with a knack for solving puzzles.

- 1+ year in the Help Desk/Customer Service arena, ready to share your wisdom and learn more.

- Strong written and verbal communication skills

- Tech-savvy, especially with Office 365

- An expert organizer with solid Microsoft Office skills.

- Quick to learn, eager to grow, and always ready for a tech challenge.

- CompTIA A+/Net+ certification or similar credentials will make you shine.

Position Details:

- Starting part-time with the option to go full-time after 180 days.

- Competitive Pay: $19.00 - $24.00 per hour

- Location: Office for duration of training with 1 day option to work from home per week after becoming a full-time employee.

Perks & Benefits:

- 401(k) matching to build your nest egg.

o After 180 days of employment

- Flex schedules for work-life harmony.

o Flexible intern scheduling 15-20 hours a week to start

o Full Time Employment offers work from home 1 day a week guaranteed.

- Premium health insurance because your well-being is a priority.

o 60/40 Healthcare split for Full Time Employees

- Paid time off to recharge and relax.

o 3 sick days

o 3 vacation days

Schedule:

- Monday to Friday, with weekend adventures optional

Experience Desired:

- Customer Service: 1 year customer service (for better or worse!)

- Help desk guru: 1 year (bring those stories!)

- Windows wizardry: 1 year (show us the magic!)

Preferred Licenses/Certifications:

- CompTIA A+ (show us what you’ve got!)

- CompTIA Cloud+ (cloud conquerors, we want you!)

- Bachelor’s Degree (Bonus Points!)

Ready to CloudSolve Your Career? Apply Now!

full-desc:
Summer Intern - Information Technology Department (Candidates must reside in the Roanoke, Va. area)Prosperity Life Roanoke, Virginia, United States (On-site)SaveApply

Prosperity Group Holdings, LP (“Prosperity”) is a holding company with three U.S. insurance entities: Shenandoah Life Insurance Company (“SHEN”), SBLI USA Life Insurance Company, Inc. (“SBLI”), S.USA Life Insurance Company, Inc. (“S.USA”); one Bermuda reinsurance entity, Prosperity Life Assurance Limited (“PLAL”); as well as an asset manager, Prosperity Asset Management, LLC (“PAM”).

Prosperity Life Insurance Group, LLC is seeking a summer intern to join the Information Technology team. This position provides a highly motivated individual with the opportunity to build an exceptional career within the Information Technology / insurance industry. The IT intern position offers knowledge of IT Programming Development and Information Systems, our businesses, and culture. The intern selected will gain experience, skills, support, and exposure needed to help launch their careers in this innovative sector. Interns typically assist with PC Support, Service Desk Support, Remote User Access, and Security Systems. Candidates should have strong oral and written communication skills. Paid internships last 10 – 12 weeks and typically begin in late-May/early-June and end in early/mid-August.

Under limited supervision, this position works with the end user community and IT Programming Development staff to support Information Systems which includes: PC Support, Service Desk support, Remote user Access, and Security Systems.

- Assist with troubleshooting of Prosperity Systems and providing End User Support

- Responds to requests for technical assistance from Prosperity Personnel, which involves answering questions over phone calls or via our ITSM ticketing system; directing inquiries to the appropriate personnel, and diagnosing and/or resolving technical problems.

- Responsible for Service Desk Support, including assisting the Level 1 and Level 2 Support teams. This can include in-office setups, imaging, boxing, shipping, receiving, hardware inventory organization, and office space cleanliness.

- Following up with clients to ensure that all systems are operating without fault.

- Assist with keeping Technical Services storage closets orderly and secure

- Assist in maintaining and updating documentation for the Service Desk

- Inspect and evaluate work done to ensure compliance with quality standards.

- Identify and recommend improvements to the quality and efficiency of our processes

· Current student pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Technology, Information Systems, or other business-related major. Minimum two years of undergraduate degree completed

- If working on an AA, you must be in the middle of the trimester (1 year into a 2-year degree) spell out Associates degree

· Sharp attention to detail

· Strong analytical; organizational and problem-solving skills

· Excited to take on new and challenging assignments

-- Must be able to communicate effectively

- Must be able to lift a minimum of 25 lbs

full-desc:
SEMA Construction, Inc., is looking for entry level Summer Interns and/or Co-Ops who are currently in the process of attaining a degree in engineering or construction management to be a part of our growing team. The Intern/Co-Op will be immersed in our projects located in Greater Central Florida. The candidate will assist Project Management in the direction of field responsibilities for both self-performing and subcontracted trades.

Major areas of responsibility include:

  • Coordinating with superintendents and foreman to ensure project goals and expectations are met.
  • Assisting Project Manager to assure project compliance with SEMA’s safety policies and OSHA safety standards.
  • Learning SEMA’s culture and standard operating procedures.
  • Assist with schedule and coordinate with foreman and field personnel with daily schedules including materials, subcontractors, equipment, quality control, etc.
  • Inspect and approve all permanent material as it arrives to the job site in conjunction with project engineers/superintendents.
  • Assist project planning to include project definition, scope, resources, and schedule.
  • Gain the basic knowledge of heavy civil construction techniques, equipment, plans, specifications and cost control.
  • Assist with specialty formwork/falsework design and detailing at a project level.
  • Assist with quantity take-offs for verification and estimating.
  • Work closely with Project Engineers, Superintendents and Estimators assisting with their daily tasks/duties as needed.

Requirements:

  • Currently pursuing an undergraduate degree in engineering, construction management or related field.
  • Ability to work full time during the summer (approx. May-August).
  • Highly motivated, with a demonstrated passion for excellence and taking initiative.
  • Strong organization, time management and attention to detail.
  • Communicate and interact effectively and professionally with supervisors, employees and others individually or in a team environment.
  • Reliable transportation to and from work and willing to travel in Florida.

SEMA Construction is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), political affiliation, military service, or other non-merit based factors.

full-desc:
Software Developer Intern: Summer (May 20th - August 9th, Monday-Friday, 8:30am-5:30pm CT)

About Us

Meritize is an education lender that uses an individual’s academic, military, and work achievements to enhance credit evaluation and expand funding for skills-based education. The Company’s proprietary merit-based lending program goes beyond traditional underwriting to leverage individual academic and experiential data, increasing access to educational funding and improving outcomes. The Meritize platform promotes the growth and development of skills-based careers on behalf of students, educators, and employers through innovative funding solutions, skills-building programs, and career success services.

Key Responsibilities

This is a 12-week, full-time summer internship. This position will be reporting to the Manager, Software Development. The primary responsibilities of the Software Developer Intern include:

  • Design, implement and manage software applications in a variety of object-oriented programming languages/technologies (i.e., Java, Ruby, etc.)
  • Write automated tests at the unit, integration, and end-to-end level with guidance from peers
  • Pair program for 6 hours per day with other developers and actively communicate with Product Managers and Designers in a cross functional team

Key Qualifications

To be eligible for this internship, applicants must have:

  • A college degree or ongoing studies in a related field
  • Be a senior or greater in college (preferred)
  • Strong critical thinking, collaboration, and communication skills

Meritize is an equal-opportunity employer.

full-desc:
About Us

Authright, established in December 2017, in Massachusetts, is a fast-growing information technology company. Our core businesses are independent research and development of security & protection products and professional IT & Data Services for a variety of customers, ranging from startups to enterprises.

Address: 888 Washington Street, Suite 301, Dedham, MA 02026

Email: career@authright.com

About the job

Identity and Access Management (IAM) Intern

According to a new study published by Polaris Market Research, the global identity & access management (IAM) market is anticipated to reach USD 25.15 billion by 2026. The increasing adoption of connected devices, Bring Your Own Device (BYOD), Internet of Things (IoT), and audit management combined with cost control are the prime components boosting the market growth. Also, the growth in online applications and risk management compliance mandates are anticipated to impel the identity & access management market and thus it is projected to gain traction over the forecast period.

During the Internship, you will be mentored by engineers and scientists that are experts in Security fields. From design to operations, you will learn to apply security engineering expertise, innovative concepts, and technology solutions to address every facet of our sponsor’s cyber challenges in three key strategic areas: threat-based operations, threat-based engineering, and security of evolving and emerging technologies.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field
  • Have a passion for security
  • Love to solve problems with efficient, solid code and prove it through automated tests
  • Be excited by shipping new features and know that delivering to production takes more than just coding
  • Strive to understand the big picture and given the choice, you would prefer to collaborate with product owners, architects, quality assurance, and infrastructure than to go it alone
  • Be continuously growing your skillset

Responsibilities:

  • This is an internship where you will gain in-depth skills in the field of IAM. You will deliver next-generation IAM implementation and solutions to top enterprises by leveraging modern IAM products such as ForgeRock, Ping Identity, etc
  • You will enroll in a series of IAM training provided by our IAM partners. These trainings usually cost thousands of dollars for the public, but you will get them for free here.
  • You will work under the guidance of senior IAM engineers
  • After finishing the training, you will start to get your hands dirty on some IAM practices and implementations
  • With your knowledge and skills improved you will be presented to our clients and work with other teammates to solve problems in the real world

Benefits

  • Paid Intern and Full-Time Hire Opportunity
  • Comprehensive training
  • Visa sponsorship is available for competitive candidates
  • Career path consulting

Job Type: Internship

Pay: From $30,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

  • When will you graduate?
  • How many years of experience do you have in IT-related field?

Ability to Relocate:

full-desc:
A Portfolio or Link to a Portfolio is Required in Order to be Considered.

We are searching for an up-and-coming web designer/graphic designer who is looking for a job in the web design and marketing field. This temporary internship position is planned for 30 hours a week, Monday through Friday. Pay is from $12-$15/hr and will be based on experience and skill level. The internship will run from the time of hiring throughout the summer.

Applicants must be able to take direction, work well in a team, have a willingness to learn, have a positive attitude, and be of good moral character. You must have a basic understanding of html and css as this will be expected from day one. Having experience with Webflow, JavaScript, Adobe XD, Photoshop or Illustrator is a plus.

Your duties will include but are not limited to: Building new websites, editing existing websites, exporting image files from XD/Figma and gathering assets for web use, troubleshooting website issues, and other miscellaneous design duties. For the sake of honesty and transparency, there is no promise or inference of a full-time position intended following the completion of the internship as new interns are brought into our program each semester.

Luna Creative is one of the top creative firms in San Antonio. We work with clients of all sizes with needs that span the spectrum of the design and marketing field. Our principled and professional work environment is fun and positive while still maintaining a fast-paced and efficient workflow. Apply today for the chance to join our young, fun and exciting design family.

full-desc:
Information Technology Internship

Your school is teaching you computer science…

we’ll teach you how to be an IT professional.

Join a cadre of interns mentored by senior engineers and architects, and have the opportunity to experience the entire IT spectrum. You’ll work on a professional, fun and thoughtful team, collaborate with customers to determine needs, and assist in implementing solid IT practices in a fast-paced environment

You will:

  • Directly participate in projects that impact our internal and external customers
  • Participate, with your mentor, in gathering and analyzing software requirements, designing software features, writing code, and/or testing the software
  • Participate in a hands-on, fun, on-boarding and training schedule to become familiarized with the multiple faces of IT in an organization.

In-office only in Lincoln, NE

As a Software Developer Intern at Sandhills Global you will have the opportunity to learn the different modern tools and technologies we use to develop industry-leading software. Each intern is placed in our developer training department where you will go through a series of tasks designed to get you familiar with our processes, procedures and tech stack that we use. Many applications within the company are web-based data driven applications that utilize .NET, SQL Server, Web APIs, and front end frameworks such as javascript, jQuery, and React.js to name a few.

Once through training, Software Developer Interns are placed within an agile team in an area that fits their skills and where we have a need, at which point they can put their new training and skills to work. As part of that team you will have the opportunity to be a part of a highly collaborative team that utilizes agile practices to develop real world software, whether its for improving operational efficiency for the company, developing services we sell to customers, or working on public websites that millions of users visit every month.

We are primarily a Microsoft shop, and utilize technologies in that ecosystem to solve business problems. C# is our primary coding language and what we use for any new projects, but we have many mature systems that are written in VB which we maintain. There are smaller areas that utilize other languages and technology such as PHP, Swift, Objective C, and Java for example, but these are project specific and the minority.

Assume other duties as assigned.

fragmented_desc: ['Utilize ROS (Robot Operating System) and Linux tools to process collected data into functional virtual maps. Test and improve RUNO’s autonomy on customer sites.']
full-desc:
About us:

Here at ViaBot, we're building a robot made to tackle real-world tasks. We're a hardware startup based in the heart of Silicon Valley and backed by numerous VCs, with a youthful and exceptional team that's ever-growing. Our aim is to change the way people see robots--not as gimmicks or as one-trick ponies, but as sensible solutions to sizable problems. Enter RUNO: an autonomous mobile robot designed to perform outdoor commercial tasks such as sweeping and grass-cutting. Learn more about us at: https://www.viabot.com

Who we're looking for:

ViaBot is searching for a tech-savvy person who is passionate about robotics, looking to employ their creativity alongside industry technology to solve real-world problems. Our ideal candidate is comfortable with Linux and the command line, and carries some off-hand skills like Photoshop/GIMP and familiarity with WASD controls. Also, this candidate won't be afraid to get hands-on with the robot hardware, and get a little dirty in the process. We're looking to hire ASAP, so apply now and you could be working with us in a week!

Responsibilities:

1. Mapping :

  • Pilot our robot RUNO 2.0, equipped with a diverse array of sensors to conduct outdoor property surveys.

2. Data Processing:

  • Utilize ROS (Robot Operating System) and Linux tools to process collected data into functional virtual maps.
  • Transform virtual maps into SVGs (Scalable Vector Graphics) into responsive web visualizations using our data processing tools and procedures, including validation and testing procedures.

3. Validation and Testing:

  • Analyze collected data to identify areas of concern in the generated maps.
  • Validate generated data and artifacts against real world
  • Test and improve RUNO’s autonomy on customer sites

Requirements:

1. Technical Skills:

  • Familiarity with Linux, VMWare, and command-line tools, including SSH and Bash.
  • Basic knowledge of image editing tools such as Photoshop, GIMP, Illustrator, Inkscape.

2. Programming Skills:

  • Basic familiarity with Python.
  • Basic familiarity with C or C++. (Bonus : C++)

3. Physical Abilities:

  • Capable of standing and walking for an average of 3 hours a day, up to 6 hours a day.
  • Able to assist in moving hardware by pushing and pulling.

4. Travel:

  • Ability and willingness to travel as required.

Recommended:

1. Technical Knowledge:

  • Basic understanding of ROS (Robot Operating System).
  • Familiarity with SQL, Node.js, Express

2. Image Editing:

  • Proficiency in Photoshop, GIMP, or similar image editing tools.

3. Graphics Editing:

  • Familiarity with graphics editors like Inkscape

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Night shift
  • On call
  • Travel, as required

What's in it for You:

Join our innovative team and embark on an exciting journey at the forefront of robotics and data technology. As a key player in our operations, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the development and deployment of cutting-edge robotic systems. You will have the opportunity to learn more about deploying an autonomous system from end to end, as well as dive into concepts of mapping, path-planning and obstacle avoidance.

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Evening shift

About Us

Meritize is an education lender that uses an individual’s academic, military, and work achievements to enhance credit evaluation and expand funding for skills-based education. The Company’s proprietary merit-based lending program goes beyond traditional underwriting to leverage individual academic and experiential data, increasing access to educational funding and improving outcomes. The Meritize platform promotes the growth and development of skills-based careers on behalf of students, educators, and employers through innovative funding solutions, skills-building programs, and career success services.

This is a 12-week, full-time summer internship. This position will report to the analytics manager. The primary responsibilities of Data Analyst Intern include:

  • Provide analytical support to varying internal business units as required
  • Respond to ad hoc reports & data requests

Key Qualifications

To be eligible for this internship, applicants must have:

  • Effective communication, both orally and in writing
  • Ability to understand and follow complex, detailed, technical instructions
  • Experience with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
  • SQL programming skills and knowledge of data visualization platforms (AWS Quicksight a plus)
  • Ability to work both independently and in a team environment

Meritize is an equal-opportunity employer.

full-desc:
Landis+Gyr is a leading global provider of integrated energy management solutions. We measure and analyze energy utilization to generate empowering analytics for smart grid and infrastructure management, enabling utilities and consumers to reduce energy consumption. Our innovative and proven portfolio of software, services and intelligent sensor technology is a key driver to decarbonize the grid. Having avoided more than 9 million tons of CO2 in FY 2021 and committed to achieve carbon neutrality by 2030, Landis+Gyr manages energy better – since 1896.
With sales of USD 1.5 billion in FY 2021, Landis+Gyr employs around 6,500 talented people across five continents.


Welcome to Landis+Gyr! We're at the forefront of the energy industry revolution - let's build a brighter energy future together!

Landis+Gyr is seeking an undergraduate Intern for Summer 2024 working on-site Monday through Friday at our Alpharetta, GA office. This is a paid position but we don't offer a housing stipend or relocation assistance so local candidates are preferred.


Project Overview/Job Description
Interesting opportunity for Software Development enthusiasts with an added bonus to get an introduction into the energy domain. The project will involve working on real world software projects, fixing code quality issues by enhancing and adding new unit tests to existing code in a Microsoft Stack environment.

In addition to learning software development and quality fundamentals, the intern will also have an opportunity to learn multiple technologies, including C#, Visual Studio, SQL, Oracle, REST APIs, Kafka, Microservices, MS Azure DevOps, Angular, Java.

To demonstrate the skills learned, the interns will be able to demonstrate quality improvements they implemented using Code Coverage reports, SonarQube reports, and defects fixed using MS Azure DevOps dashboards.


Student Objectives/Responsibilities:
  • Fixing and enhancing code unit tests under guidance of an experienced Senior Software Engineer


  • Working with hardware and testing software.


  • Monitoring the Jenkins builds and analyzing unit tests failures.


  • Analyzing SonarQube reports and creating defects in ADO for fixing issues reported by the tools.


  • Upgrading existing NuGet package tests to .Net Core


  • Updating MS Azure DevOps defects fixed as part of the project.

Qualifications Sought:
  • Interest in Software development


  • Self-motivated to learn new technology. Should be comfortable with C# and .NET.


  • Enthusiastic about online research and problem solving.


Education: An undergraduate student who has completed their Freshman year or higher seeking their Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.


If you have the drive and enthusiasm to accept this challenge and to work in a very dynamic, cross functional and international environment, we are looking forward to meeting you.

About RF:

ReliabilityFirst Corporation is a regulator focused on the reliability and security of the electric grid. ReliabilityFirst’s mission is to preserve and enhance the reliability, security, and resilience of the Bulk Power System across 13 states and the District of Columbia. ReliabilityFirst is uniquely positioned to work closely with transmission, generation, and other power companies as well as the federal government to help identify and ensure the mitigation of operational risks and physical and cyber security threats to the electric grid.

Purpose of Position:

The Data Analytics Intern requires you to perform day-to-day activities associated with analyzing and maximizing the data sources and outputs available in the Analytic Services group; and to perform, organize and conduct analytical activities and projects to support the quantification of grid reliability. It is also desirable for this position to be responsible for the quality and timeliness of specific business deliverables. This position will also support and implement the policies and programs established by ReliabilityFirst.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Ability to support Analytical activities such as SQL queries and coding.
2. Ability to support organizational activities associated with the Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence (BI) reports and dashboards, and others as needed.
3. Ability to support design and creation of database tables and views in SQL from predefined data sources.
4. Ability to support Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) processes for the tables created above.
5. Ability to support unit testing including test plan creation, execution, and documentation in preparation for code review and migration/elevation.

Qualifications:

1. Progress in pursuing bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science or Analytics field.
2. Computer skills: familiar with Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel and Power Point.

Desirable:

1. An understanding of or experience with any of various languages such as SQL, Python, R, and DAX.
2. Practical skills in Excel with knowledge of spreadsheet functionality including v-look-up and pivot tables.
3. An understanding of or experience with Power BI or any similar business intelligence tool.
4. An understanding of data manipulation, data analysis, database use, and mathematics.

ReliabilityFirst is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees and applicants in accordance with local and federal laws. ReliabilityFirst's mission is to preserve and enhance bulk power system reliability and security. This mission cannot be accomplished without a diverse and inclusive staff - one that at all levels feels empowered, valued, respected, and engaged.

Learn more at: Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at RF (rfirst.org)

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Intern – Software Development

UNITE HERE seeks two (2) Software Developer Interns to be a part of the Union’s technology team supporting campaigns. Our technology teams based in the New York metropolitan area and across the country are dedicated professionals with a strong commitment to our mission. If you are a creative problem-solver looking to help build and support the next generation of labor union technology and try new things in a fast-moving organization, you will love working with us.

UNITE HERE is a progressive, member-driven, not-for-profit union, dedicated to organizing workers in the hotel/hospitality, gaming/casino, and food service (including at airports and cafeterias) industries to lift workplace standards across the United States and Canada. You will be part of a team that empowers workers—primarily women, people of color and immigrants—in low-wage service sector jobs to achieve better wages, benefits, dignity, and rights at work.

Position Summary: We are entering our second year building our foundational team, transitioning to an in-house team rather than relying heavily on 3rd parties for software development. The Software Developer Internship is a 9-week role for a rising college senior, recent graduate, or equivalent, who is flexible and eager to learn and grow. The Intern will be supported on a few projects by a Software Developer to make important contributions to software to drive campaigns. The Intern will also have direct campaign interaction as well.

· Develop new features, enhance existing features, upgrade packages, improve supportability, and fix or troubleshoot on UNITE HERE’s software suite.

full-desc:
About RF:

ReliabilityFirst Corporation is a regulator focused on the reliability and security of the electric grid. ReliabilityFirst’s mission is to preserve and enhance the reliability, security, and resilience of the Bulk Power System across 13 states and the District of Columbia. ReliabilityFirst is uniquely positioned to work closely with transmission, generation, and other power companies as well as the federal government to help identify and ensure the mitigation of operational risks and physical and cyber security threats to the electric grid.

Purpose of Position:

The IT Specialist will be responsible for supporting our in-house IT department in providing technical assistance, maintaining both cloud and on-prem systems, strengthening our cybersecurity posture, and helping to implement and train staff on new technologies. It is also desirable for this position to be able to research and present to the IT team information regarding IT best practices and improvements to our existing processes and systems.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Work directly with staff and customers on software-related issues to minimize delays
2. Under IT staff guidance, install, configure, and troubleshoot computer systems, both hardware and software
3. Monitor our technology stack for issues and analyze our security reports for threats
4. Break down data from multiple sources and provide trends and areas of improvement to the IT Department
5. Work with all staff to share in technology training
6. Participate in multiple IT projects and commitments
7. Participate in performance process and applying feedback
8. Willing to travel up to (10%)

Qualifications:

1. Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree or Technical degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field.
2. Computer skills: Experience or Knowledge in system security, networking, servers, and cloud-based SaaS.

Desirable:

1. Knowledge of computer systems and software
2. Knowledge of networking
3. Familiarity with foundational networking
4. Desire to learn further cloud-based cybersecurity
5. Willing to train and troubleshoot end-users
6. Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
7. Strong communication and customer service skills
8. Able to work independently and as part of a team

ReliabilityFirst is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees and applicants in accordance with local and federal laws. ReliabilityFirst's mission is to preserve and enhance bulk power system reliability and security. This mission cannot be accomplished without a diverse and inclusive staff - one that at all levels feels empowered, valued, respected, and engaged.

Learn more at: Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion at RF (rfirst.org)

Job Type: Internship

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Ability to Relocate:

  • Independence, OH 44131: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Independence, OH 44131

full-desc:
Astronics AeroSat Corporation recently relocated to Manchester, New Hampshire doubling the size of our building in order to support our projected growth. We design and manufacture tail-mounted and fuselage-mounted aircraft SATCOM systems to provide inflight internet and live TV connectivity for commercial and business aviation, VVIP, and military aircraft around the world.

Astronics AeroSat Corporation is seeking for a Software Engineer Internship to support a diverse range of projects and responsibilities.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Performing software module and system level testing.
  • Running acceptance test protocols for the purpose of:
  • Identifying areas where operator feedback can be improved.
  • Reviewing the generated test reports.
  • Review Python based acceptance test protocols for the purpose of:
  • Adding commenting to the code that outline main purpose of modules and functions.
  • Identifying main data structures.
  • Mapping the modules dependencies.
  • Identifying areas where coupling can be reduced.
  • Gaining exposure to real world multi module applications .
  • Generate pseudocode code for system performance testing.
  • Attend code reviews.
  • Maintain ace of the System Integration Lab.

full-desc:
Best Egg is the leading financial confidence platform that provides flexible solutions to real-life challenges for people with limited savings. We leverage real-time customer insights and data science to connect more people with the right products for their financial needs. Our offers include a growing suite of products such as personal loans, a credit card, and flexible rent, which are complemented by a suite of financial health tools to help customers make smart financial decisions and stay on track, so they can be money confident no matter what life throws at them.
Our culture and values inspire our employees and customers to embrace Best Egg. We are committed to championing a culture of inclusiveness and diversity of thought, and we focus on providing a safe, flexible, and collaborative work environment. Our employees are encouraged to engage in creative problem solving, and we promote opportunities for growth and enrichment across the organization.
If you are inspired by inspiring others, Best Egg is the place for you.

Best Egg promotes diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better we will grow.

Best Egg is seeking a Software Engineering Co-op who is eager to contribute to a cross-functional agile team and help develop internal and customer-facing software. You can expect to enjoy a culture embracing the concepts of continuous delivery, total quality management, knowledge sharing, personal and career advancement, empowerment, innovation, and collective ownership.

This role will report to the Technology - Software Engineering & Architecture Department

You will spend most of your time doing:

    • Actively contribute to code.
    • Work closely with the Engineer Lead and members of the backend team.
    • Participate in the Agile development cycle.

Ideal fit for this role:

    • Comfort with at least one of: Python, Java.
    • Understanding of the principles of object-oriented programming.
    • Experience with SQL database fundamentals.
    • Creative problem-solving skills.
    • Ability to interact and collaborate productively with technical and non-technical colleagues.
    • Demonstrated record of independence and perseverance.
    • Effective and proactive communication skills with peers and managers.
    • Curiosity and a readiness to learn new skills, strategies, and technologies.
    • Computer science, computer engineering, and related fields, for individuals possessing the desired technical skills.
$20 - $24 an hour

Our Brand:
At Best Egg, we believe money should be accessible so people can reach their goals, live a fuller life, and feel pride in knowing they have taken control of their finances. For those who need extra money to achieve the progress they seek in life, Best Egg is the modern solution-minded finance provider that mixes decades of banking experience with smart technology and deep customer insight to create products designed for today’s borrower, so that people can establish a smoother financial path. The egg symbolizes protection and a fresh start.

Employee Benefits
Best Egg offers many additional benefits for our employees, including (but not limited to):
  • Pre-tax and post-tax retirement savings plans with a competitive company matching
program
  • Generous paid time-off plans including vacation, personal/sick time, paid short-
term and long-term disability leaves, paid parental leave, and paid company
holidays
  • Multiple health care plans to choose from, including dental and vision options
  • Flexible Spending Plans for Health Care, Dependent Care, and Health
Reimbursement Accounts
  • Company-paid benefits such as life insurance, wellness platforms, employee
assistance programs, and Health Advocate programs
  • Other great discounted benefits include identity theft protection, pet insurance,
fitness center reimbursements, and many more!

In compliance with the CCPA, Best Egg is fully committed to handling the personal information and data of employees and job applications responsibly with respect and due care.

fragmented_desc: ['The project will consist of field mapping, water sample collection and monitoring, and GIS digitization. The intern selected will work with the MRP team and…']
full-desc:
Job Summary

Geology & GIS Intern

Project Name: Project Flow

Project Duration: 3months

Paid Internship: The pay rate for this internship is commensurate with the candidate's years of schooling and major.

The pay scale is between $15 - $26 per hour.

Requirements:

  • Bachelors degree preferred
  • Coursework Prerequisites: Geology, Hydrology, Hydrogeology, Mining Engineering, GIS digitization and field mapping

Location: Sylacauga, Alabama

PROJECT SCOPE:

The project intends to support the site’s efforts in understanding and providing an updated map of all water-related features within the site’s main quarries. Focus on North Quarry is a priority and this project will support the site’s larger hydro/geophysical efforts planned for 2024. The project will produce an updated hydrology map for the site.

PROJECT DESCRIPTION & DELIVERABLES:

The project will consist of field mapping, water sample collection and monitoring, and GIS digitization. The intern selected will work with the MRP team and site technical staff to map, monitor, and observe surface (and groundwater) features in and around the main quarries to determine all water-related inputs and outputs for the Sylacauga quarries.

PROJECT LEARNING OBJECTIVES:

Field mapping, water sampling/monitoring, GIS map creation, and collaboration.

What we offer you:

  • Responsibilities as of Day 1 – you will feel the ownership of your project from the beginning, and you will be given specific projects and responsibilities
  • Continuous coaching & mentoring– We'll help you work with passionate people and also receive both formal training and mentoring from your manager
  • Visibility of Senior Leaders
  • Dynamic and respectful work environment – employees are at the core; we value every individual and encourage initiatives promoting agility and work/life balance
  • Priority in the selection process for Imerys Full-time positions – upon successful completion of your Co-Op and university graduation, you will be given priority in hiring into full-time positions

Intern/Co-Op details:

  • We provide relocation support to get you where we need you.
  • We offer competitive wages
  • We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $15.00 - $26.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

  • Sylacauga, AL: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

fragmented_desc: ['Experience using data visualization tools, such as Tableau or Power BI, to present insights and analyses. Experience with transitioning raw data sets into data…']
full-desc:
The Intern will support the Member and Constituent Engagement Data Insights Program.

To advance member engagement and mature AAMC’s knowledge of member and constituent behaviors, the Member Engagement/Member Services Unit has established an engagement data insights program within the unit.

The purpose of the program is to:
  • Improve the staff’s knowledge of member and constituent characteristics and behaviors
  • Use existing member and constituent data to make informed business decisions (and help other business units do the same)
  • Support the development of a “data curious” culture within AAMC
  • Serve as data partners to business stakeholders to support
  • Outreach
  • Promotion
  • Richer engagement
  • Better business outcomes
  • Identification of engagement or business opportunities
The Member Engagement/Member Services Unit is responsible for key business operations used to advance AAMC’s vision of a highly engaged membership association. The unit oversees 3 portfolios:
1) Membership Operations: this includes the management of 600+ member organization records; collection of association dues (representing 10% of the association’s total revenue); and ownership of critical software platforms including the Association Management System (AMS).
2) Member Benefits & Services: this includes management of 160,000+ records for individuals with relationships to AAMC member organizations; management of 30,000 constituent participations in AAMC affinity groups and other communities; communication and outreach efforts to constituents; annual support of 8,000+ customer inquiries; and management of AAMC’s job board, CareerConnect.
3) Engagement Insights and Analytics: this includes management and oversight of the Member and Constituent Engagement Data Insights Program; development of enterprise analytics dashboards; support across the enterprise for providing customer insights for better business decisions and targeted marketing; and management of enterprise customer surveys.

Development Opportunities:
Since this program is in its early stages, supporting this work offers an opportunity to be in at the ground level. The Intern will have opportunities to conduct hands-on work in Power BI. The Intern will participate in customer discovery conversations that will inform the development of dashboards and insights. The Intern will be able to provide insights for creating and designing enduring solutions; solutions that will be in place long after the internship is over. The Intern will have the ability to achieve tangible projects to reference at the end of the internship that will demonstrate the anticipated or realized business impact of using data analytics to drive business decisions.
Responsibilities:
The Intern will work directly with the Senior Director of Member Engagement and the Member Engagement Senior Data Analyst to assist them with existing projects.
Those projects include:
  • Conduct analyses of member engagement data.
  • Work with internal customers to fulfill requests for engagement data.
  • Generate reports, dashboards, and presentations to be shared with association leaders and business partners for decision-making purposes.
  • Provide targeted data sets to support marketing, promotional, and outreach efforts.
Qualifications:
We are looking for a graduate student. This individual will likely have a background in business analytics or information technology.
Candidates should have:
  • Strong SQL skills
  • Experience using Python
  • Experience using data visualization tools, such as Tableau or Power BI, to present insights and analyses
  • Experience with transitioning raw data sets into data models for analysis and hypothesis testing
  • Experience with application of statistical theories

Remote Work Eligibility
This position may be eligible for remote work.
Compensation Grade Range and Mid-Point
Grade Range:$18.00 - $26.00/ Grade Mid-Point:$22.00
The above annual compensation range and mid-point are general guidelines. For candidates who meet the criteria, the AAMC's compensation philosophy is to target the midpoint of the salary range. Multiple factors are taken into consideration to arrive at the final hourly rate/annual salary to be offered to the selected candidate. Factors include, but are not limited to, the scope and responsibilities of the role, the selected candidate’s work experience, education and training, as well as internal equity, market, and business considerations.
If a bachelor’s degree is required, related work experience may be substituted in some positions. One year of college course work at an accredited institution is equivalent to one year of related work experience.
The Association of American Medical Colleges (AAMC) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. The AAMC is committed to the policy of an equal employment opportunity in recruitment, hiring, career advancement, and all other personnel practices. The AAMC will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, national origin, religion, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibilities, matriculation, political affiliation, genetic information, disability, past or current military service, or any other legally protected characteristic.
Please attach a resume as part of the application process. It is important that files DO NOT include periods ( . ) within the file name.
BROWSER REQUIREMENTS: Applications must be submitted using Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Safari, or Microsoft Edge.

full-desc:
At Trane Technologies® we Challenge Possible. Our brands – including Trane® and Thermo King® - create access to cooling and comfort in buildings and homes, transport and protect food and perishables, connect customers to elevated performance with less environmental impact, dramatically reduce energy demands and carbon emissions, and innovate with a better world in mind. We boldly challenge what’s possible for a sustainable world.

Job Summary:
Trane Technologies’ early career student program internships provide current college students with challenging assignments, leadership training, valuable exposure to our company's senior leaders and opportunities to network. Our 12-week summer internship opportunities offer candidates working toward their Bachelor's or Master’s in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering exposure to a variety of assignments which could include: Software Development, Sustaining Engineering, Product Management, Application & Systems Engineering, or Modeling & Simulation.


At Trane Technologies, we value our people and their development. Through our student programs, participants will have an opportunity to interview for our full-time, post-graduate Accelerated Development Program for Engineering or direct hire opportunities. Click here to learn more.

This posting supports multiple positions and the work arrangements will reflect the nature of the selected role. This could include Hybrid or Onsite work arrangements.



Successful Candidate’s Profile:

We are looking for performance-driven, innovative leaders who understand the importance of collaboration and customer focus. A successful candidate will exhibit the following:

  • Collaborate with others to foster effective teamwork by linking own responsibilities to the team’s goals and needs - zeal for new information, knowledge, and experiences

  • Rapidly resolve problems to maximize customer satisfaction

  • Establish courses of action for self and others to ensure work is completed efficiently, such as, prioritizing tasks based on importance

  • Willing to be mobile and relocate anywhere in the United States

  • Pursuing a BS/MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Software Engineering with a cumulative overall GPA at or above 3.0

  • Minimum Work Experience: At least one internship or work experience

  • Demonstrated leadership skills such as: campus organizations, sports team captain, resident advisor, etc. or exceptional leadership of work projects

  • U.S. citizen or have the legal right to work in the U.S. without requiring sponsorship now or in the future


We offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits and programs that help our employees thrive in both their professional and personal lives. We are proud of our winning culture which is inclusive and respectful at its core. We share passion for serving customers, caring for others, and boldly challenging what’s possible for a sustainable world.

full-desc:
We are currently seeking a Data Science Intern to join our team for an enriching internship experience where they can apply theoretical knowledge to real-world projects.

PlanetArt internships are full-time positions, and interns should expect to work Monday-Friday,
up to 40 hours per week typically between 9am-6pm. Specific team norms around working
hours will be communicated by your manager. Interns should not have conflicts such as classes
or other employment during the PlanetArt workday. Applicants should have a minimum of one
quarter/semester/trimester remaining in their studies after their internship concludes. By
applying to this position, your application will be considered for the Data Science Intern
role located in Calabasas.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with data analysts, scientists, and engineers to understand and contribute to the development of machine learning models for predictive analysis and data-driven solutions.
  • Participate in the cleaning, manipulation, and analysis of large datasets to uncover actionable insights and inform company decisions.
  • Assist in the design and implementation of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to optimize data workflow.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data and track key performance indicators (KPIs) using tools such as Tableau.
  • Contribute to the enhancement of data quality and reliability through rigorous validation and testing of models.
  • Engage in research activities to stay abreast of the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, and related technologies.
  • Support the data science team in ad-hoc analysis and presentation of results to stakeholders.

Requirements

Requirements:

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Familiarity with SQL and experience with database systems such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, or similar.
  • Proficiency in Python, data science libraries, and traditional machine learning libraries (such as Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, StatsModels) for data science and machine learning prototyping tasks.
  • Basic understanding of business statistics, machine learning concepts, and algorithms.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently on assigned tasks.
  • Eagerness to learn and apply new skills in a fast-paced environment.

Working Conditions:

  • Work is performed in an office environment with low to moderate noise levels.
  • Position requires regular, continuous use of computer.
  • Position requires regular interaction with team members through the following methods: in-person, phone, WebEx, Slack, or email.
  • This is a hybrid position; employees are expected to be in the office three days per week (Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday) with the option of working remotely two days (Wednesday and Friday).

Benefits

The base pay for this position is $19.00 an hour.

full-desc:
About Peraton
Peraton is a next-generation national security company that drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted, highly differentiated solutions and technologies to protect our nation and allies. Peraton operates at the critical nexus between traditional and nontraditional threats across all domains: land, sea, space, air, and cyberspace. The company serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies and supports every branch of the U.S. armed forces. Each day, our employees do the can't be done by solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. Visit peraton.com to learn how we're keeping people around the world safe and secure.
Responsibilities

Peraton is seeking Summer 2024 Interns to become a part of our hands-on and multi-faceted intern program at various Peraton sites, predominantly in the Northern Virginia/ Washington DC metro area. Depending on the program and given the current workforce climate, the summer internship may be able to be supported remotely.

This position is a pipeline position with a purpose to collect applicants. No hires will be made against this position.

If you're looking to contribute to real-time, customer-focused work related to your field of study, then Peraton's 10 week internship program may be perfect for you! Our intern program places an emphasis on developing the next generation's workforce; designed to provide college students with the opportunity to learn about Peraton, gain meaningful real world work experience in a professional environment, and work on programs that enable missions of national importance. As part of our internship curriculum we provide the opportunity for each intern to interact with various branches of the company. This includes attending brown bag sessions with our executive leadership team, joining developmental learning lessons, and participating in team-building activities with mentors and fellow interns. We foster a culture of mentoring, continuous learning, and team orientation that will be evident from your first day on the job. Our goal is to build a road-map that leads you to a long, rewarding, and challenging career with Peraton! We work with you to determine your desired career path, and the correct steps to achieve your goals.

Under direct supervision, our interns perform various hands-on tasks and assignments for the organization's professional staff in disciplines such as Engineering, Software Development, Database Management, Security Threat Analysis, Human Resources, Marketing, and Finance.

Internship Advantages:

  • Meaningful work related to national security and space intelligence.

  • Primary channel for full-time, entry-level hires.

  • Competitive pay.

  • Opportunity for government security clearance, depending on the requirements dictated by the program.

  • Interaction with executives and leadership.

  • Organized professional development and social activities.

We ask that each intern be available to work the duration of the ten weeks (June to August) and commit to working a minimum of 35 hours per week. This program is geared toward technical college students, actively enrolled at a four year university, who will be rising into their junior or senior years. However, strong underclassmen may be considered if they have declared their major and have completed qualified coursework.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

  • HS Diploma and some advanced level training.
  • US Citizenship is required.
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a government security clearance, if applicable, and dictated by the program/contract.
  • Must be actively pursuing a 4 year degree at an accredited university.
  • Must be pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Mathematics, Business, Information Technology, Business, Finance, Human Resources or related field.
  • An ideal candidate will have a 3.0 and above GPA.
  • A passion for learning, helping others, and contributing value to the mission in any way possible.
  • Ability to create, sustain, and enhance fostering of team dynamics and collaboration.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to quickly adapt and learn new technologies and concepts.
  • You are self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, responsible team-player.
Desired Qualifications:

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Proficiency using Microsoft office.
  • An ideal candidate would be a rising junior or senior. Target Salary Range

SCA / Union / Intern

SCA / Union / Intern Rate or Range
$20/hour+
EEO
An Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Veteran.

Our Values

Benefits
At Peraton, our benefits are designed to help keep you at your best beyond the work you do with us daily. We're fully committed to the growth of our employees. From fully comprehensive medical plans to tuition reimbursement, tuition assistance, and fertility treatment, we are there to support you all the way.

full-desc:
Looking for a great place to work where you can work with a terrific team of people, build a great professional career. We know that our people are our greatest resource because their success is our success. We're committed to providing our team with a supportive, positive work environment that encourages team trust and achievement.

Job Overview:

We are seeking a skilled and experienced part-time Web Developer to join our team. As a Web Developer Intern, you will be responsible for formatting, coding, and modifying existing website. You will work closely with the manager to understand the updates needed and translate them into effective web solutions. If you have a passion for web development and enjoy creating user-friendly websites, we would love to hear from you.

- Collaborate with designers to create visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces

- Write well-designed, efficient code using best practices

- Conduct website testing and debugging

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure website functionality and performance

- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in web development

-Perform keyword research in coordination with business objectives to optimize existing content and uncover new opportunities

- Experience with wireframing tools and UX/UI design principles

- Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and continuous integration tools (e.g., Jenkins)

- Knowledge of backend programming languages such as Java is a plus

- Ability to troubleshoot and debug complex web applications

- Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

- Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members

We offer competitive compensation based on experience, proficiency, accuracy and knowledge.

If you are a talented Web Developer, still in college looking for an exciting opportunity to showcase your skills and contribute to the success of our projects, please apply now.

full-desc:
CooperVision, a division of CooperCompanies (NASDAQ:COO), is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of soft contact lenses. The Company produces a full array of daily disposable, two-week and monthly contact lenses, all featuring advanced materials and optics. CooperVision has a strong heritage of solving the toughest vision challenges such as astigmatism, presbyopia and childhood myopia; and offers the most complete collection of spherical, toric and multifocal products available. Through a combination of innovative products and focused practitioner support, the company brings a refreshing perspective to the marketplace, creating real advantages for customers and wearers. For more information, visit www.coopervision.com

Job Summary:

Reporting to the Sr. Global Data Analyst, this internship position will help to support project analytics for global BI and Data initiatives.

Essential Functions:

  • Collaborate with other team members to understand goals and work to meet them.
  • Manage specific project(s) as defined to their conclusion.
  • Maintain project Gantt chart to assist in accomplishing key objectives of the project within the designated timeline.
  • Assist with analytics on projects as defined.
  • Work cross-functionally to collect needed information required to complete project as defined.
  • Organize and analyze data sets to determine trends and key information useful to meet the project objectives.
  • Projects may include:
  • Business Intelligence Analytics
  • Promotions impact analysis
  • Pricing analysis
    • Proof of Concept on data insights for

Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Knowledgeable and enthusiastic about analyzing and interpreting business data.
  • Ability to quickly learn and thrive in a new environment.
  • High level of ownership, accountability and initiative
  • Strong organizational and follow-through skills, as well as attention to detail and ability to carry out tasks independently.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills – verbal and written.
  • Excellent presentation skills.
  • Display expertise in Excel for analytical use.
  • Other analytical tool use is a plus.
  • Professional demeanor.
    • Ability to meet deadlines.

Work Environment:

  • Normal office environment
  • Willing to report to work in the Pleasanton CooperVision office.
  • Prolonged sitting in front of a computer.
    • This is a paid internship.

Experience:

  • Applicant will be pursuing a major preferably in Marketing, Finance, Economics or Statistics
  • Prior experience with data modeling and analysis required.
    • Demonstrated expertise in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

Education:

  • Current college student, majoring in statistics, economics, analytics are preferred. Focus on the business environment is important. Preferred Masters candidates, although strong undergraduates will be considered.
    • GPA >3.5 is a plus.

Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran

For U.S. locations that require disclosure of compensation, the starting base pay for this role is between $26.50 and $30.25 an hour and may include cost of living adjustments. The actual base pay includes many factors and is subject to change and modification in the future. This position may also be eligible for other types of compensation and benefits.

full-desc:
Overview of Position

Assurant is looking for Spring and Summer IT Interns! The internship is designed for recent college graduates to gain a well-rounded introduction to and experience in Information Technology. The internship will focus on Application Development and equip you with transferrable skills that can help you anywhere you go. The program is a paid internship for up to six months focused on application development and automation. Throughout the internship, you will be connected with technical and leadership mentors, allowing you to work on the things you are most passionate about. You will engage in immersive learning experiences, from Dojos to tech talks, and have the opportunity to showcase your work with our leadership team.

This position is a 40-hour-per-week program and mostly works from home.

We’ll also look for individuals who might be a good fit to join us full-time after graduation. We’ll share more throughout the program.

The target pay for this intern role is $30/hr.

The amount may differ due to a wide range of factors, including candidate background, experience, and work location.

We’ll provide learning opportunities to further your development with concepts to include:

  • Plan, Develop, Implement and/or Support applications in various languages and disciplines

  • Collaborate with product owners to ensure that development work will meet the needs and expectations of the business

  • Research, solve for, and engage others as necessary to develop solutions resulting in the desired business outcome.

  • Ability to work and think independently to produce working code

  • Perform system testing on all code produced to uncover and resolve defects before engaging others in evaluating functionality.

  • Work through and resolve production issues for applications supported by the department or functional area.

  • Prepare documentation on work produced to ensure a smooth handoff to other developers, as needed.

You bring your experience, knowledge & skills:

  • Positive attitude and willingness to learn

  • Project or Team Work

  • Presentations & Tech challenges

  • Creative problem solver

  • Ability to demonstrate logical thinking

  • Community Involvement:

  • Clubs or troops

  • Volunteering engagements

  • Community support

Education:

  • Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Development, Information Systems, or a related program at an accredited university.


Any posted pay range considers a wide range of compensation factors, including candidate background, experience, and work location, while also allowing for salary growth within the position.

Helping People Thrive in a Connected World
Connect with us. Bring us your best work and your brightest ideas. And we’ll bring you a place where you can thrive. Learn more at jobs.assurant.com.

For U.S. benefit information, visit myassurantbenefits.com. For benefit information outside the U.S., please speak with your recruiter.

What’s the culture like at Assurant?
Our unique culture is a big reason why talented people choose Assurant. Named a Best/Great Place to Work in 13 countries and awarded the Fortune America’s Most Innovative Companies recognition in 2023, we bring together top talent around the world. Although we have a wide variety of skills and experiences, we share common characteristics that are uniquely Assurant. A passion for service. An ability to innovate in practical ways. And a willingness to take chances. We call our culture The Assurant Way.

Company Overview
Assurant is a leading global business services company that supports, protects, and connects major consumer purchases. A Fortune 500 company with a presence in 21 countries, Assurant supports the advancement of the connected world by partnering with the world’s leading brands to develop innovative solutions and deliver an enhanced customer experience through mobile device solutions, extended service contracts, vehicle protection services, renters insurance, lender-placed insurance products, and other specialty products.

Equal Opportunity Statement
Assurant is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not use or consider race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law in employment decisions.

full-desc:
The Software Engineering Intern will be a passionate, opinionated and creative individual who can develop web applications from the ground up. You will understand web strengths and constraints and build pixel perfect solutions. You should be capable, and willing, to assist in developing responsive single-page web applications.

Duties will include:
  • Develop efficient, secure applications, peer-review code, and document solutions within an agile-blended software environment
  • Collaborate with other senior engineers, and management, to achieve optimal application design
  • Communicate proactively with teammates, infrastructure, security, and quality assurance to continuously improve processes and engineering excellence
  • Work on Web based applications and Services utilizing Java, Spring, Hibernate, AngularJS and Java Script.
  • Learn quickly and be productive in a highly collaborative, lightning-fast environment.
  • Follow and Promote best practices in Software Development
  • Experience developing cutting edge applications
  • Experience designing and building single page applications using any Javascript Framework.
  • Knowledge in at least one client side MVC JavaScript framework (preferably ReactJS or ReactNative)
  • Experience developing modular front-end components and building web experiences using HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript
  • Knowledge of web standards, cross-browser compatibility and constraints of the web
  • Understanding of browser rendering behavior and performance
  • Good written and communication skills
  • Experience with Agile methodologies
  • Completed Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science
